description: From Middle English enhauncen, anhaunsen, from Anglo-Norman anhauncer (“enhance, raise”), from Vulgar Latin *inaltiāre (“raise”), derived from Latin in + altus (“high”). The /h/ in Old French was taken from haut (“high”), where it resulted from Frankish influence.

verbs.description: enhance (third-person singular simple present enhances, present participle enhancing, simple past and past participle enhanced)

entries.meaning: To augment or make something greater.
To improve something by adding features.
(intransitive) To be raised up; to grow larger.
examples: A debt enhances rapidly by compound interest.

entries.meaning: (radiology) To take up contrast agent (for an organ, tissue, or lesion).
